knowledgeBase.content: The Voice Coding Assistant (VCA) is a real-time, voice-driven web application designed to assist users with coding queries, system design, meeting summaries, and interactive learning. It leverages advanced AI models to provide responses, generate code, and create diagrams.

Key features include: Voice Recognition (Browser Web Speech & OpenAI Whisper), Multiple AI Agent Modes (Coding, System Design, Tutor, Diary, Meeting Summary), Code Highlighting, Mermaid Diagram Generation, Cost Tracking, Dark/Light Theme, and a Responsive Design.
The General Assistant is your versatile AI companion for a wide range of questions and tasks. It can provide information, engage in conversation, and help with general queries.
The Coding Assistant helps with programming problems, understanding code, debugging issues, and learning coding concepts. It can provide code examples and explanations for various languages.

For best voice recognition results: 
1. Speak clearly and at a moderate pace. 
2. Minimize background noise. 
3. Use a quality microphone if possible. 
4. If using Whisper API mode, short pauses are generally fine. For Browser Web Speech, longer continuous speech might be split automatically.
If you encounter issues or have questions, please refer to the project's GitHub repository issues section. For critical problems, contact the administrator if this is a deployed instance.
